channel.title: Coding on Grad Student Problems
channel.description: Recent content in Coding on Grad Student Problems

item.title: Stack Overflow
item.description: I used to code before internet was something you could have at your home, it wasn’t even the next big thing. You had to go to an internet caf√© to look at yahoo and hotmail, so basically you didn’t. I read books about coding (remember Let us C?) and coded in Turbo C. If you needed to know what the functions are in a library, or why a certain error was popping up, you read the source code, what else could you do?

item.title: My First Post
item.description: I spent the entire day today configuring Hugo so that I can write a blog. The alternative was of course using the free, efficient, easy to use, readily configurable blog sites. What be life without a little pain? In my college I owned a shitty Acer laptop with an utterly useless battery and a cooling system so bad that the fan would act as a noise cancelling device for the din outside.
